title: In an advanced explanation, how can hydroxyl groups bind to each other? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hydroxyl groups bind through the formation of hydrogen bonds. The classic example is water (See below H-bond between two water molecules, the hydrogen bond is the hatched one). Also shown are three waters interacting in 6-membered ring. Such interactions can be extended in all directions - it begins to look like the structure of diamond. Of course, these interactions are dynamic/transitory.

Hydroxyl groups bond to each through dipole-dipole interactions and through the mixing of the orbital containing the nonbonded electrons of the oxygen and sigma star orbital of the hydrogen atom. In other words, they interact through hydrogen bonding.
